Vulnerability.Title: grubby bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The grubby packages provide grubby, a command-line tool for displaying and editing GRUB (GRand Unified Bootloader) configuration files. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the manual pages for grub2 boot loader stated incorrect location about the configuration file and the default boot loader on the supported Red Hat Enterprise Linux architectures. The manual pages have been updated to contain correct information about the configuration file and the default boot loader. (BZ#1001664) Prior to this update, while adding LILO entries the $VERSION variable was used to set labels on boot images. As a consequence, adding multiple boot images with the same version on zipl-based platforms failed with a duplicate entry error. With this update, the grubby packages have been updated to use the "--banner" option in the boot entry. As a result, zipl-based systems can now add boot images that use the same version. (BZ#1032048) Prior to this update, when installing new kernels, grubby used arguments of "linux" and "initrd" regardless of the system's architecture. Consequently, grubby could create the grub.cfg file on AArch64 with non-EFI (Extensible Firmware Interface) arguments, which are unsupported on this architecture. With this update, only EFI arguments are passed to grub.cfg on AArch64. As a result, the system can boot as expected. (BZ#1081269) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: With this update, a debugging boot entry has been added to the /etc/grub.cfg file by default. It is no longer necessary to enable debugging manually. (BZ#957681) Users of grubby are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
